title: allow ⌘-` as "quick switch window" keybinding

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
This is a macOS-only concern.

I run VSCode exclusively in native fullscreen mode.  _By default_ macOS' system-level "shortcut" for "Move focus to next window" is bound to ⌘-`:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/924465/60914950-7751ce00-a23f-11e9-8852-8799a2719b0a.png)

"Move focus to next window" _does nothing_ when apps run in native fullscreen.  When focused on a fullscreen window, macOS will _not_ switch between "spaces" to access a different window (fullscreen or not) from the same app.  Each native fullscreen window is considered its own "space."

However, VSCode's "quick switch window" keybinding (`workbench.action.quickSwitchWindow`) does just that; it will switch between these native fullscreen windows.  But binding it to ⌘-` is disallowed by VSCode's "keyboard shortcuts"  GUI.  Hand-editing the JSON is possible--but it doesn't actually create the binding.

I am not sure if there's a technical reason for this, or just a "recommendation" from Apple that apps don't allow binding to the shortcut.  I _do_ know that in JetBrains' IDEs, ⌘-` works akin to "quick switch window" with multiple native fullscreen windows, so there either a) isn't an OS-level embargo on using the shortcut, or b) JetBrains found some way to trick macOS into switching across spaces.

If a VSCode window is _not_ run in native fullscreen, and a user uses ⌘-` to switch windows, I would expect that VSCode would either a) override macOS' system-level shortcut, or b) delegate to it.  I don't know what's preferred, as long as VSCode exhibits the behavior expected by the user.

Please let me know if this is an Electron-specific issue; if so, please close this.

title: A11y_VSCode_ WelcomeScreen_ScreenReader: The role and name of the interactive element is not announced to screen reader users.
body:
**Environment Details:**
VSCode Version : 1.35.6 (user setup)
OS Version : MAC OS Mojave, V 10.14.5, Mac Mini Late2012

GitHubTags: #A11yMAS; #A11yTCS; #MACOS; #DesktopApp #A11y_VSCodeEditor; #MAS4.1.2

**Additional Details:**
MAS Violated : MAS 4.1.2
ScreenReader Versions : Voiceover

**Repro Steps:**
1.	Open Visual studio code editor.
2.	Using "Alt+H" key navigate to the "Help" menu bar option.
3.	Using "Down" arrow key navigate to the "Welcome item".
4.	Start screen reader.
5.	Navigate to “Tools and Languages” and “Settings and keybindings” interactive elements.
6.	Listen if it's name and role of these elements is announced or not.

**Actual:**
When screen reader users navigate to the “Tools and Languages” and “Settings and keybindings” interactive elements the name and the role of these elements are not announced to the screen reader users

**Expected:**
The name and role of the interactive elements should be announced to the screen reader users when they navigate to it.

**Recommendations:**
Refer below link which is repository of bug fixes code snippets:
[https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/mas/pages/browse-fixes.aspx](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/mas/pages/browse-fixes.aspx)

**User Impact:**
If the name and role of the interactive elements are not announced to the screen reader users then they will not understand how to interact with them.

**MAS Reference:**
MAS 4.1.2 - [https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={248054a6-5e68-4771-9e1e-242fb5025730}](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={248054a6-5e68-4771-9e1e-242fb5025730})

**Attachment for Reference:**
[VSCode_ WelcomeScreen_ScreenReader Role and Name not announced in MAC.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/files/3372887/VSCode_.WelcomeScreen_ScreenReader.Role.and.Name.not.announced.in.MAC.zip)

title: Hirerarchical multi-root layout
Add support of relative paths for ```git.ignoredRepositories```

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
_Originally posted by @r44083 in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/47890#issuecomment-506282034 pulling this up into an issue rather than a comment in a merged PR_

Hi, could you please add support of relative ```git.ignoredRepositories``` path? So it could be possible to add ignored repository in the following way:
```
"git.ignoredRepositories": ["./openwrt"]
or 
"git.ignoredRepositories": ["${workspaceFolder}/openwrt"]
```
instead of
```
"git.ignoredRepositories": ["/home/username/some/absolute/path/openwrt"]
```

title: Do not update disabled extensions

body:
Today I noticed that VSCode updates and installs extensions even if they are disabled. In fact, I was reminded of a couple of extensions I no longer use by the hundreds of megabytes downloaded in the background.

Could you consider adding this as a toggle in settings or disabling this behavior altogether?

title: "Go to File" / quick open is slow when entering the full relative path
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.36 and 1.37-insider
- OS Version: Mac 10.14.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start VSCode, open a large workspace, e.g. a clone of [mozilla-central](https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/).
2. Press cmd-P, and enter a file name, let it finish (this is to allow VSCode to seed the cache).
3. Copy a filename from another app (e.g. terminal), then switch back to VSCode and press cmd-P, paste the file name using cmd-V.
  * At this stage, VSCode completes almost immediately.
4. Press enter to open it
5. Now copy a relative path from the other app, switch back, cmd-P and cmd-V.
  * Now wait about 5 - 10 (or more) seconds for the completion to appear.

Given this is a relative path, it should be able to find it just as quickly as searching for the filename.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

**Additional Details:**
MAS Violated : MAS 1.3.1
Screen Reader Versions : NVDA2019.1.1 JAWS2019

**Repro Steps:**
1.Open Visual studio code editor.
2.Using "Ctrl+`" key open the Integrated Terminals.
3.Navigate to terminal action toolbar.
4.Navigate to combo box and expand it using alt+down arrow key.

**Actual:**
Screen reader does not announces the expand state of terminal selection combo box.

This issue has been observed in "Win 10 + JAWS" and "Win10 + NVDA".

**Expected:**
Screen reader should announce the expand and collapse state of combo box.

**Recommendations:**
Refer below link which is repository of bug fixes code snippets:
[https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/mas/pages/browse-fixes.aspx](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/mas/pages/browse-fixes.aspx)

**User Impact:**
If the expand state of combo box are not announced then the screen reader users will not get the exact information.

**MAS Reference:**
MAS 1.3.1 - [https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4})

title: WebViewPanel created with preserveFocus: true suffers from a focus problem.
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Version: 1.37.0-insider
Commit: d50852db1af10ec100a71ad57cc3a04c8aead117
Date: 2019-07-08T05:33:31.335Z
Electron: 4.2.5
Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
Node.js: 10.11.0
V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
OS: Darwin x64 17.7.0
- OS Version: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6 (17G7024)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Execute the following sample code of extension.
2. Execute the `Hello World` command.
2. Click the tab of WebView and press the `f` key of the keyboard.
3. In the conlose, only the `window focused!` message shown.
4. Click the tab of WebView, again. Then, press `f`.
5. The message `keyboard F typed!` shown.

![Jul-08-2019 19-18-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10665499/60803049-46c55200-a1b5-11e9-833a-5a20f80725b6.gif)


```typescript
import * as vscode from 'vscode';

export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
  const rootUrl = vscode.Uri.file(context.extensionPath)
  const disposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('extension.helloWorld', async (args, brgs, crgs) => {
    if (!vscode.window.activeTextEditor) {
      return;
    }
    
    const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel(
      'catCoding',
      'Cat Coding',
      { preserveFocus: true, viewColumn: vscode.ViewColumn.Beside },
      { enableScripts: true }
    );
    panel.webview.html = getHtml();
  });
  context.subscriptions.push(disposable);
}

function getHtml() {
	return `
<!DOCTYPE html><html><head></head>
<body>
<script>
window.onfocus = function() {
	console.log('window focused!');
}
window.addEventListener('keydown', function(evt) {
	if(evt.keyCode == 70 && evt.target.nodeName != 'INPUT') {
	  console.log('keyboard F typed!')
	}
  })
</script>
`
}


// this method is called when your extension is deactivated
export function deactivate() {}
```


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Find and replace panel will end up in an inconsistent state
body:
In some cases, replacement does not work based on how it is set in Find panel.  
So you see "Find in selection" enabled, you have a Selection, click Replace, but replacing will use a different selection. Of course, this problem exists even without using replace, just to search the selection.

- VSCode Version: 1.36.0
- Commit: 0f3794b38477eea13fb47fbe15a42798e6129338
- Date: 2019-07-03T13:20:56.241Z
- Electron: 4.2.5
- Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
- Node.js: 10.11.0
- V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
- OS: Linux x64 5.1.16-200.fc29.x86_64

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Start VSCode without extensions `code --disable-extensions`, open new file and paste this code:

```text
aaa aaa aaa aaa
bbb aaa aaa bbb
aaa aaa ccc ddd
```

2. Select first word on second line `bbb`.
3. Open Find panel `CTRL+F`. ("Find in selection" is on)
4. Change selection to `ccc ddd`
5. Open replace part of the Panel and type `xxx`
6. Press "Replace all"

**Bug:** **Replacement was executed, ignoring actual selection,** outside of selected text, even "Find in selection" is on. (So this panel is working with some "archive" / not actual state.)

**Any use of Find Panel should not change the original selection.** After the user manually adjusts the selection (in background), the change should also be reflected in the Find panel. Without it you can end up in state, that `aaa` is in search input, `ccc ddd` is selected, "Find in selection" is enabled, but in spite of all that, when you start the replacement for `zzz`, two replace are executed outside of selection.

_The proposed behavior is described in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/76856 request._

title: Selection is changed when using Find and Replace panel
body:
When using the Find and Replace panel, the Selection is changed without user intervention.

This is a bug of **high importance** (for any editor) because **you cannot trust the result of the replacement**.

For example, if you have the "misake" text in the file several times and you are trying to fix it, you cannot trust the result after using Replace, that it actually replaced all the results you requested. Because there may be a situation where the selection that the user has made does not match the one used by the Find panel (after some operations, even though the selection has not changed by user).

- VSCode Version: 1.36.0
- Commit: 0f3794b38477eea13fb47fbe15a42798e6129338
- Date: 2019-07-03T13:20:56.241Z
- Electron: 4.2.5
- Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
- Node.js: 10.11.0
- V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
- OS: Linux x64 5.1.16-200.fc29.x86_64

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Start VSCode without extensions `code --disable-extensions`, open new file and paste this code:

```text
aaa aaa aaa aaa
bbb aaa aaa bbb
aaa aaa ccc ddd
```

2. Select entire second line `bbb aaa aaa bbb` including line break (the cursor should be in front of the first character of the third line).
3. Open Find panel `CTRL+F`.
4. Type `aaa`
5. Turn off "Find in selection"
6. Turn on "Find in selection"

**Bug:** Selection for replacement was changed without user intervention.

**Any use of Find Panel should not change the original selection.** The standard expectation is that the Find panel finds two occurrences of the string "aaa" (in line 2) but the active selection has changed to the first text "aaa" on line #3 if you would now start the replacement, only first occurrence of "aaa" on last line would be replaced and not what you expect (that is, all occurrences in the last selection entered by user)

_The proposed behavior is described in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/76856 request._

title: Unusable pre-filed value after openning the Find panel
body:
The pre-filled value after opening the Find panel is unusable in some cases.

- VSCode Version: 1.36.0
- Commit: 0f3794b38477eea13fb47fbe15a42798e6129338
- Date: 2019-07-03T13:20:56.241Z
- Electron: 4.2.5
- Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
- Node.js: 10.11.0
- V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
- OS: Linux x64 5.1.16-200.fc29.x86_64

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Start VSCode without extensions `code --disable-extensions`, open new file and paste this code:

```text
aaa aaa aaa aaa
bbb aaa aaa bbb
aaa aaa ccc ddd
```

2. Select any `aaa` text.
3. Open Find panel `CTRL+F`.

**Bug:** The pre-filled value is `aaa` and "Find in selection" is enabled. Such a setting (to fill selected word when only this word is entire selection) makes no sense. If you mark a word, you are most likely to look for it outside the selection. Or you search for previous searched value in new selection. **Search entire selection inside entire selection makes no sense.**

_Note:_ In the case of multiline selection, the pre-fill is correct. The last search value is pre-filled, and the button "Find in selection" is marked on.

_The proposed behavior is described in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/76856 request._

title: For long completion items, truncate the start of the string instead of the end
body: Raised at https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/1837, if the completion items are really long, VS Code truncates them at the end: I'll see if we can change this completion so it doesn't include the full path, but it seems like VS Code could maybe be smart here - the visible characters of all the completions here are the same thing as is visible in the document (which is being used to filter) so it would be much better to truncate from the start than the end (for ex., if the label starts with the text being used to filter, then truncate from the start).

Steps to Reproduce:

It's **a glitch only**, everything works as usual.

title: Emojis don't work under ConPTY

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I am giving rust and rocket a try. Rocket uses lots of unicode icons for it's output. With WinPTY all icons are replaced by placeholders, which is kind of fine. With ConPTY some are shown, and some aren't. But the really bad thing is, that some other characters get lost.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1215681/60793424-fe337780-a167-11e9-93bf-9d7172237aa3.png)

The image shows two starts of the same program, to demonstrate the major problem.
In the first output the url ("http://localhost:8000") is completely printed. In the second output the last to numbers of the port are missing and also the last two letters of the word "development".

After stopping the program AND hitting enter one more time, the output of the second run is the same as the first run -> The missing characters are added in default color and boldness.

title: Set Language-Specific Default Template for New Files
body:
The ability to set a template/scaffold when creating new files. For example creating a New_File.html in explorer that would already have something like:
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
   <title>${file's actual name}</title>
</head>
<body>
  
</body>
</html>
```
Much like triggering a snippet on file creation that is not bloating suggestions.

title: PHP auto-closing HTML tags
body:
When editing a plain HTML file typing `"</"` brings up closing tag suggestions popup

When the file type is "PHP" though - this does not work. It would be a great addition.

title: More than 100000 values in an array on debugging mode
body:
On VS Code debugging mode, when I have an array / vector / map or etc, with more than 100000 values, and then click on it on debugging panel, VS Code tries to load all the values, obviously is unable to, so, infinitely loads. I am supposed to restart VS Code, temporary decrease the maximum value to 1000, and restart debugging mode.

But a better solution may be this: 
If the number of values is more than 1000, just load the first 1000 values! There can be a button on the debugging panel to increase the number of loaded values.

title: Allow to run VSCode hidden in the background for faster opening
body: Issue Type: Performance Issue The application is too long to open. Sometimes, i just want to open a draft page to save some part of code or anything else. Maybe you could add an option to keep a caching process in the background in order to launch the app as fast as w10 apps ^^ VS Code version: Code 1.35.1 (c7d83e57cd18f18026a8162d042843bda1bcf21f, 2019-06-12T14:30:02.622Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18932

title: The `cursorWordPart`* commands are limited to editor text, unlike the other `cursorWord`* commands
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.36.0 (system setup)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Focus on a non-editor input text field (e.g. execute the command `workbench.action.quickOpen` or `actions.find`, inter alia)
2. Insert the text of the multi-part word "fooBar".
3. Move the cursor to the end of the multi-part word text.
4. Enter your keybinding for the command `cursorWordPartLeft`.

Expected behavior:

* Cursor moves to between "foo" and "Bar", i.e. `foo|Bar`.

Actual behavior:

* No effect.

Notes:

* This limitation appears in all `inputText` contexts other than the `editorText` context.
* This limitation affects all the `cursorWordPart`* commands:
  * `cursorWordPartLeft`
  * `cursorWordPartLeftSelect`
  * `cursorWordPartRight`
  * `cursorWordPartRightSelect`
  * `cursorWordPartStartLeft`
  * `cursorWordPartStartLeftSelect`
* The corresponding whole-word commands (those without the "Part" infix) are not limited, i.e. they function in `inputText` contexts other than the `editorText` context.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Use URI for backupPath
body:
I introduced a new URI property called `backupWorkspaceResource` in window configuration. This is being used on the renderer.

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/2a88776f07d7d8bebca2e78491b204c6eaf45169/src/vs/platform/windows/common/windows.ts#L421-L422

Please adopt and use `backupWorkspaceResource` property also on electron main side

title: TypeScript code lens treats `interface`s differently from `type`s
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Given:

``` ts
{
    interface Foo {
        foo: number
    }
    
    type F = Foo;
    
    const foo: Foo = {
        foo: 1
    }
}

{    
    type Foo = {
        foo: number
    }
    
    type F = Foo;
    
    const foo: Foo = {
        foo: 1
    }
}
```

If we compare the behaviour of the code lens for the `interface` and `type`, they are different:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/921609/60717329-6b9d9900-9f19-11e9-8cd5-d0ec14022e6a.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/921609/60717349-72c4a700-9f19-11e9-979d-451bed67f018.png)


As a user, I want the behaviour that `interface` has to also apply to my `type`:

- Show implementation count
- Object members should show reference counts

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: A11y_VSCode_ WelcomeScreen_ScreenReader: The role and name of the interactive element is not announced to screen reader users.
body:
**Environment Details:**
VSCode Version : 1.35.1 (user setup)
OS Version : Win10

GitHubTags: #A11yMAS; #A11yTCS; #Win32; #DesktopApp; #A11y_VSCodeEditor; #MAS4.1.2

**Additional Details:**
MAS Violated : MAS 4.1.2
ScreenReader Versions : NVDA2019.1.1, JAWS 2019

**Repro Steps:**
1. Open Visual studio code editor.
2. Using "Alt+H" key navigate to the "Help" menu bar option.
3. Using "Down" arrow key navigate to the "Welcome item".
4. Start screen reader.
5. Navigate to “Tools and Languages” and “Settings and keybindings” interactive elements.
6. Listen if it's name and role of these elements is announced or not.

**Actual:**
When screen reader users navigate to the “Tools and Languages” and “Settings and keybindings” interactive elements the name and the role of these elements are not announced to the screen reader users

This issue has been observed in "Win 10 + JAWS" and "Win10 + NVDA".

**Expected:**
The name and role of the interactive elements should be announced to the screen reader users when they navigate to it.

**Recommendations:**
Refer below link which is repository of bug fixes code snippets:
[https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/mas/pages/browse-fixes.aspx](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/mas/pages/browse-fixes.aspx)

**User Impact:**
If the name and role of the interactive elements are not announced to the screen reader users then they will not understand how to interact with them. 

**MAS Reference:**
MAS 4.1.2 - [https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={248054a6-5e68-4771-9e1e-242fb5025730}](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={248054a6-5e68-4771-9e1e-242fb5025730})

**Attachment for Reference:**
[VSCode_ WelcomeScreen_ScreenReader Role and Name not announced.pptx](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/files/3361502/VSCode_.WelcomeScreen_ScreenReader.Role.and.Name.not.announced.pptx)

title: Distinguish which workspace folder a symbol belongs to in Ctrl-T search for symbol (Go To Symbol)
body:
#### When I Ctrl-T & type `Abc` (a class) to search for a symbol, it now show 3 symbols that I cannot distinguish like this :

Abc - \<namespace> - abc.php
Abc - \<namespace> - abc.php
Abc - \<namespace> - abc.php

#### This is because my workspace have 3 folders (project), and each with the same class Abc (but in different folders on disk). Could you consider adding the workspace folder hinting like this (when the workspace have multiple workspace folders) so that I can distinguish the three?  E.g.

Abc - \<namespace> - abc.php (workspace_folder_1)
Abc - \<namespace> - abc.php (workspace_folder_2)
Abc - \<namespace> - abc.php (workspace_folder_3)

Remark: I think this scenario is quite common and so fired this request.

title: Update detects code.exe instances from other users with seperate install folders

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Two users on the same Windows machine each with their own version of VS Code installed in different folders.
Both users run VS Code, the update now button is pressed by one user and that user closes his VS Code to finish update.
Error message pops up saying that VS Code is still running, although all instances of that user's VS Code are terminated.
Confirmed that the each user's instances all originate from their own user's install folder.

Expected Results:
Users in multiple user environment with separate install folders can update normally, by checking only for running instances of code.exe that originate from the respective install location.

title: Fix leftwards word jumps.
body:
:wave: Hey Coders! This patch addresses the issue first described in #32246, again in #48046 and #41199, and very possibly elsewhere.

VSCode’s `cursorWordStartLeft` and `cursorWordEndRight` commands were implemented such that the caret moved between every word boundaries: navigating a string like `this.is.a.test` would require seven keystrokes (`this|.|is|.|a|.|test|`). Since most platforms jump over the far side of a boundary (`this|.is|.a|.test|`), it felt graceless and awkward.

Worse: the commits which closed the original issues fixed left-to-right movement (<kbd>⌥</kbd>+<kbd>→</kbd>), but right-to-left navigation (<kbd>⌥</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd>) was either untouched or broken again later. Q.v. the latest Insiders build:

![insiders](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2207980/60680358-008c8d80-9e59-11e9-8c00-95a74e9fbbd8.gif)

Since I’m new to the codebase, this is a potentially quite naïve solution—all I did was true up `WordOperations.moveWordLeft` to `WordOperations.moveWordRight`. If there’s a cleverer way I’m happy to take another shot at it.

For now, though, it seems to work. Here’s the very-OS-native Sublime:

![st3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2207980/60680536-b8ba3600-9e59-11e9-94ad-b2ca17bc5661.gif)

…and here’s this branch’s build:

![patched](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2207980/60680563-c7085200-9e59-11e9-9f20-0a7f0bdf97f9.gif)

Thanks for taking a look, and please let me know if I can improve it.
